main_definition: Witnesses are individuals who observe an event or incident either directly or indirectly, providing testimonies that may be used as evidence.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To see or perceive something personally
meanings_and_examples.example: I witnessed a car accident from my office window.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Individuals who provide testimonies in legal settings
meanings_and_examples.example: The jury was presented with the testimony of several witnesses to the crime scene.

meanings_and_examples.definition: People present at an event or occurrence, serving as observers
meanings_and_examples.example: Several neighbors were witnesses to the loud argument that took place last night.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Those who bear testimony regarding events of historical significance
meanings_and_examples.example: Historians rely on firsthand witness accounts from soldiers in World War II.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To testify to the truth or existence of an event, especially in a formal manner
meanings_and_examples.example: She will need to give her account as a witness in court.
